channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ex-Fed Governor Kugler quit after more trading violations
item.description: Kugler requested a waiver to conduct financial transactions to address what the Fed official described as impermissible financial holdings.

item.title: Laura Loomer teases Georgia move after President Trump says he wants Marjorie Taylor Greene primaried
item.description: Laura Loomer hints at Georgia move after Trump withdraws support for Marjorie Taylor Greene, sparking speculation about potential 2026 primary challen...

item.title: Democratic Rep. Brad Sherman denies viewing pornography on flight after viral photos surface online
item.description: California congressman Brad Sherman faces viral backlash after photos appeared to show him viewing explicit images on a tablet during a flight, sparki...

item.title: Border czar Tom Homan slams Catholic Church, says a ‘secure border saves lives’
item.description: Border czar Tom Homan accused the Catholic Church of being “wrong" on immigration, arguing that enforcing U.S. border laws saves lives.

item.title: Trump gives Jan. 6 defendant a second pardon for firearm offenses
item.description: President Trump has pardoned Dan Wilson, a participant in the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol, for a second time, this time for illegally possessi...

item.title: Learning from Rembrandt at Florida’s Norton Museum of Art
item.description: He nurtured plenty of talented students whose work is on view along with the only Vermeer in private hands.

item.title: ‘The system’s about to break’ — Thousands of court-appointed lawyers and staffers haven’t been paid since June
item.description: A spending bill pending for 2026 comes up $196 million short and money to pay these federal attorneys will likely run out in June.

item.title: Sen. Fetterman shares graphic photo after heart rhythm scare, says doctors ‘put me back together’
item.description: Sen. John Fetterman of Pennsylvania shared a recovery selfie showing 20 stitches after his hospitalization for a heart condition flare-up that caused ...

item.title: Trump has 'sort of' made up his mind on next steps on Venezuela
item.description: President Trump said he has met with his military team to decide whether to continue bombing boats off Venezuela.

item.title: If you think beef is expensive now, just wait until next year when prices could soar nearly 60%
item.description: "Families are going to see $10-a-pound ground beef in the grocery store."

item.title: The War on Plastic Is Getting Out of Hand
item.description: We can rethink plastic waste solutions without draconian bans on effective cups, bags, and forks.

item.title: Federal officials confirm Homeland Security officers are in Charlotte for immigration enforcement

item.title: ‘A national security problem and a homeland security problem’: The world targets Southeast Asia’s notorious scam centers
item.description: The U.S. announced on Thursday that it will start a new "Scam Center Strike Force" to target cybercriminals based in Southeast Asia

item.title: The Trump administration engaged in a ‘concerted campaign to purge’ left-wing views from top universities, judge says in UCLA funding case
item.description: The ruling bars the Trump administration from cutting federal funding to UCLA over antisemitism claims.

item.title: Trump rips MTG for betraying GOP

item.title: Expect the Comey and James Indictments to Be Dismissed Without Prejudice
item.description: The initial appointment of the prosecutor in these cases was untenable — and Bondi’s fix doesn’t work.

item.title: Nuremberg Puts Evil on the Stand
item.description: The film about the pivotal Nazi trials poses uncomfortable and critical questions.

item.title: Yes, President Trump Can Pardon The 77 People Prosecuted For 2020 Election Integrity Efforts
item.description: Media wrongly insist that the pardon clause only applies to federal charges, yet every attempt to narrow the scope of pardons has failed.

item.title: Congress Didn’t Give Trump an Unlimited License to Tariff
item.description: The best legal argument for the Trump tariffs assumes that we are currently in a declared war with every country on the planet.

item.title: Ken Burns’ The American Revolution Kicks Off the Quarter-Millennial Celebrations
item.description: The famed documentarian takes on the American founding, and the result is an inspiring reminder that we have much to be grateful for.

item.title: After Removing Statue Of American Hero, UVA Plans To Replace It With Massive Land Acknowledgement

item.title: With Jocelyn Benson Set To Referee Her Own Race For Governor, Michigan GOP Asks DOJ To Monitor Election
item.description: Michigan Sec. of State Jocelyn Benson, a Democrat, will oversee her own election results when she appears on the ballot.
